HDG.LOG.content: [Heidegger’s ear] hearing more than just picking up sounds, if it is [anatomical, biological], goes in one ear out the other [but, apprehension lives (lebt) only when embodied (leibt)] > in that case, we are not gathered to what is addressed (Zugesprochene) [heterotautology of hearing and hearkening (Horchen)] > wrong direction: turn anatomical hearing into a spiritual one
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: [Heidegger’s ear] hearing more than just picking up sounds, if it is [anatomical, biological], goes in one ear out the other [but, apprehension lives (lebt) only when embodied (leibt)] > in that case, we are not gathered to what is addressed (Zugesprochene) [heterotautology of hearing and hearkening (Horchen)] > wrong direction: turn anatomical hearing into a spiritual one

HDG.BC.content: [almost Freudian] unrest as the surge of mere life revealing itself, to remain thrust/forced into its own craving belongs to essence of living [conatus] > man over animal can elevate living/craving into guiding measure, make it the “principle” of “progress” [Kant]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [almost Freudian] unrest as the surge of mere life revealing itself, to remain thrust/forced into its own craving belongs to essence of living [conatus] > man over animal can elevate living/craving into guiding measure, make it the “principle” of “progress” [Kant]

HDG.BC.content: place of man w/in beings (being that calculates, gift of reason), organism that deifies “reason” (1st happened in French Revolution) > “life” not, for man, object standing opposite him: life is what life itself accomplishes, enjoys, survives, what it guides through itself, carries by its own stream [river, Heraclitus], life is (as taught since 19th Century) “lived experience (Erlebnis)” > life veritably “overflows” w/ “lived experiences”
HDG.BC.linkedContent: place of man w/in beings (being that calculates, gift of reason), organism that deifies “reason” (1st happened in French Revolution) > “life” not, for man, object standing opposite him: life is what life itself accomplishes, enjoys, survives, what it guides through itself, carries by its own stream [river, Heraclitus], life is (as taught since 19th Century) “lived experience (Erlebnis)” > life veritably “overflows” w/ “lived experiences”

HDG.BC.content: one can capture “lived experiences” in reports > essence of man securely delimited: man is the presencing animal (animal rationale) [?] > balance btwn “calculability” of life & drunkenness of lived experience > anthropology, Americans seek determination of what man is, how he can be most efficiently/effectively used (am wirksamsten zu gebrauchen sei) , in most appropriate place, w/out loss of time or energy [Marx-like]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: one can capture “lived experiences” in reports > essence of man securely delimited: man is the presencing animal (animal rationale) [?] > balance btwn “calculability” of life & drunkenness of lived experience > anthropology, Americans seek determination of what man is, how he can be most efficiently/effectively used (am wirksamsten zu gebrauchen sei) , in most appropriate place, w/out loss of time or energy [Marx-like]

HDG.FS.content: Marx reverses Hegel’s idealism (uniquely), requires that Being be given precedence over consciousness [?] > for Marx, Being is production process, receives this representation from metaphysics via Hegel’s interpretation of life as process
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Marx reverses Hegel’s idealism (uniquely), requires that Being be given precedence over consciousness [?] > for Marx, Being is production process, receives this representation from metaphysics via Hegel’s interpretation of life as process

HDG.FS.content: most extreme danger [the worst?]: man feels only necessity of self-production (question of computer language) > physics can’t leap beyond itself, nor can politics (which lives today in dimension of science)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: most extreme danger [the worst?]: man feels only necessity of self-production (question of computer language) > physics can’t leap beyond itself, nor can politics (which lives today in dimension of science)

HDG.FS.content: nothing characterizes being: ontological proposition > when nothing & its negating aren’t understood negatively, being is something entirely other (etwas ganz und gar Anders) than a being > participle “nihilating (nichtend)” as determinate activity of being, durch die allein das Seiende ist > name it an origin if all ontic-causal overtones are excluded [possible?]: Ereignis of Being as condition for arrival (Ankunft) of beings: das Sein lasst das Seinde anwesen [factical life]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: nothing characterizes being: ontological proposition > when nothing & its negating aren’t understood negatively, being is something entirely other (etwas ganz und gar Anders) than a being > participle “nihilating (nichtend)” as determinate activity of being, durch die allein das Seiende ist > name it an origin if all ontic-causal overtones are excluded [possible?]: Ereignis of Being as condition for arrival (Ankunft) of beings: das Sein lasst das Seinde anwesen [factical life]

HDG.FS.content: Weltlichkeit der Welt (Umweltanalyse) > Heidegger explains how, for first time [in Being and Time], being-in-the-world (In-der-Welt-sein) discovered as primary/irreducible fact, always already given, radically “prior” to consciousness [factical life] > still, this facticity is only “concrete” way of approaching project itself [the guiding aim (das leitende Ziel)] > [facticity subordinate to the Seinsfrage]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Weltlichkeit der Welt (Umweltanalyse) > Heidegger explains how, for first time [in Being and Time], being-in-the-world (In-der-Welt-sein) discovered as primary/irreducible fact, always already given, radically “prior” to consciousness [factical life] > still, this facticity is only “concrete” way of approaching project itself [the guiding aim (das leitende Ziel)] > [facticity subordinate to the Seinsfrage]

HDG.MA.content: Nobel prize winners declare “Science is a road to a happier human life” > this statement as far as possible from reflective insight into our age, forget to ponder/ask: what is ground that enabled modern technology to discover/set free new energies in nature? > nature has become a “gigantic gasoline station” [Ge-stell] (technical epoch developed in 17th century Europe)
HDG.MA.linkedContent: Nobel prize winners declare “Science is a road to a happier human life” > this statement as far as possible from reflective insight into our age, forget to ponder/ask: what is ground that enabled modern technology to discover/set free new energies in nature? > nature has become a “gigantic gasoline station” [Ge-stell] (technical epoch developed in 17th century Europe)

HDG.MA.content: releasement (Gelassenheit) toward things: “yes” & “no” to technology, let devices into our life but remain dependent on something highter
HDG.MA.linkedContent: releasement (Gelassenheit) toward things: “yes” & “no” to technology, let devices into our life but remain dependent on something highter

HDG.DL.content: Heidegger associates phenomenological experience (Erlebnis) w/ “consciousness,” subject/object, refers life back to “I” > Heidegger tried to leave this experience behind in hermeneutic relation of two-fold [Heidegger affirms Erfahrung over Erlebnis?], but “nobody can in just one single leap take distance from the predominant circle of ideas,” especially re: well-worn tracks (langem eingefahrenen Bahnen)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: Heidegger associates phenomenological experience (Erlebnis) w/ “consciousness,” subject/object, refers life back to “I” > Heidegger tried to leave this experience behind in hermeneutic relation of two-fold [Heidegger affirms Erfahrung over Erlebnis?], but “nobody can in just one single leap take distance from the predominant circle of ideas,” especially re: well-worn tracks (langem eingefahrenen Bahnen)

HDG.LP.content: in Trakl’s “Seven-Song of Death,” death: the Untergang to which ein Fremdes is called [the going down of a stranger]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: in Trakl’s “Seven-Song of Death,” death: the Untergang to which ein Fremdes is called [the going down of a stranger]

HDG.LP.content: soul: great giver of life > everything that is alive is painful > pain is the animator (Beseelende) [cf. 180 the soul is the animator] > only the soulful fulfills destiny, capable, gifted as such, of joining in harmony the mutual bearing (wechselweisen Sichtragens) by which all living things belong > relation of fitness (Bezug des Taugens), all that lives is fit, i.e. good: good is good painfully > only true in pain > because pain is converse, kann das Lebende sein Mitanwesendes in seiner jeweiligen Art verbergend entbergen [sheltering concealment], wahr-haft [preservation/truth] sein lassen [truth as letting beings truly be what they are]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: soul: great giver of life > everything that is alive is painful > pain is the animator (Beseelende) [cf. 180 the soul is the animator] > only the soulful fulfills destiny, capable, gifted as such, of joining in harmony the mutual bearing (wechselweisen Sichtragens) by which all living things belong > relation of fitness (Bezug des Taugens), all that lives is fit, i.e. good: good is good painfully > only true in pain > because pain is converse, kann das Lebende sein Mitanwesendes in seiner jeweiligen Art verbergend entbergen [sheltering concealment], wahr-haft [preservation/truth] sein lassen [truth as letting beings truly be what they are]

HDG.LP.content: the friend becomes a stranger by listening to one, sings of the death, the going under, of the departed & sings of the decaying Geschlecht the stranger parted (schied)
HDG.LP.linkedContent: the friend becomes a stranger by listening to one, sings of the death, the going under, of the departed & sings of the decaying Geschlecht the stranger parted (schied)

HDG.WL.content: attempting a way to language by speaking testifies (bezeugt) that language has woven us into speaking [why?] > this web (Geflecht) is the predetermined realm (vorbestimmten Bereich) that any reflection on language (linguistic theory, philosophy of language, etc.) must live (aufhalten) [factical life of language]
HDG.WL.linkedContent: attempting a way to language by speaking testifies (bezeugt) that language has woven us into speaking [why?] > this web (Geflecht) is the predetermined realm (vorbestimmten Bereich) that any reflection on language (linguistic theory, philosophy of language, etc.) must live (aufhalten) [factical life of language]

HDG.WL.content: Ereignis gathers the Aufriss of Sage & unfolds it into Gefüge of manifold Showing, Ereignis is most inconspicuous (Unscheinbarste) of phenomena, simplest of simplicities, nearest of near, farthest of far—in which mortals spend their lives
HDG.WL.linkedContent: Ereignis gathers the Aufriss of Sage & unfolds it into Gefüge of manifold Showing, Ereignis is most inconspicuous (Unscheinbarste) of phenomena, simplest of simplicities, nearest of near, farthest of far—in which mortals spend their lives

HDG.TC.content: deliberately speaking of annihilation (Vernichtung), not just destruction (Zerstörung): annihilation is the more encompassing (umfassendere) destruction (also takes into account destruction of countless lives) > can only speak of annihilation by intimations (Andeutungen), point away from what is not meant > annihilation not the highest grade of destruction but essentially other (wesenhaft anderes) than destruction > always something left over w/ destruction, no “remainderless (restlose)” destruction > there is no annihilation at all: the destruction where nothing left remaining, this remainder (Übrig) is nothing: has consumed (aufgezehrt) every “is” & itself > from destruction to annihilation, a change of condition, leap into another essence > not only nothing still left remaining in annihilation, but something, and only, of its own arises (entsteht)
HDG.TC.linkedContent: deliberately speaking of annihilation (Vernichtung), not just destruction (Zerstörung): annihilation is the more encompassing (umfassendere) destruction (also takes into account destruction of countless lives) > can only speak of annihilation by intimations (Andeutungen), point away from what is not meant > annihilation not the highest grade of destruction but essentially other (wesenhaft anderes) than destruction > always something left over w/ destruction, no “remainderless (restlose)” destruction > there is no annihilation at all: the destruction where nothing left remaining, this remainder (Übrig) is nothing: has consumed (aufgezehrt) every “is” & itself > from destruction to annihilation, a change of condition, leap into another essence > not only nothing still left remaining in annihilation, but something, and only, of its own arises (entsteht)

HDG.EC.content: too deplorable [?] to waste a complaint (Klage) on blinded leading-astray of our own people, the devastation of our native soul > the men had decided to remain silent about this devastation (Verwüstung), which existed for a long time, & can’t be reduced to a visible enumeration—not the result of instances of human death
HDG.EC.linkedContent: too deplorable [?] to waste a complaint (Klage) on blinded leading-astray of our own people, the devastation of our native soul > the men had decided to remain silent about this devastation (Verwüstung), which existed for a long time, & can’t be reduced to a visible enumeration—not the result of instances of human death

HDG.EC.content: that which suffocates (Erstickende) does so hiding behind something insidious (Verfänglichen), that which announces (kundgibt) itself as one of man’s highest ideals: progress (Fortschritt), unrestrained achievement in all areas of creating, equal employment opportunities, & (the highest rationale) uniform welfare for all workers > what is really devastating is the way man obsesses with these goals (Ziele), devotes everything to their realization, driving on devastation (reinforcing its own consequences) [almost Freudian death drive logic]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: that which suffocates (Erstickende) does so hiding behind something insidious (Verfänglichen), that which announces (kundgibt) itself as one of man’s highest ideals: progress (Fortschritt), unrestrained achievement in all areas of creating, equal employment opportunities, & (the highest rationale) uniform welfare for all workers > what is really devastating is the way man obsesses with these goals (Ziele), devotes everything to their realization, driving on devastation (reinforcing its own consequences) [almost Freudian death drive logic]

HDG.EC.content: desert is wasteland, deserted abandonment (Verlassenheit) of all life, nothing can emerge from itself [Greek physis] in this wasteland, & in this emergence (Aufgang) call others into a co-emerging (Mitaufgehen) > no perishing (Untergehen) in this desolation
HDG.EC.linkedContent: desert is wasteland, deserted abandonment (Verlassenheit) of all life, nothing can emerge from itself [Greek physis] in this wasteland, & in this emergence (Aufgang) call others into a co-emerging (Mitaufgehen) > no perishing (Untergehen) in this desolation

HDG.EC.content: abandonment of life as abandonment of Being, no longer allows for any beings > or, is a historical age where “life” in some form holds sway (herrscht), “the age of devastation”? [biopolitics?]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: abandonment of life as abandonment of Being, no longer allows for any beings > or, is a historical age where “life” in some form holds sway (herrscht), “the age of devastation”? [biopolitics?]

HDG.EC.content: under appearance of secured/improving life, a barring (Verwehrung) of life could occur: the being of all that is, ambiguous (zweideutig) to the core
HDG.EC.linkedContent: under appearance of secured/improving life, a barring (Verwehrung) of life could occur: the being of all that is, ambiguous (zweideutig) to the core

HDG.EC.content: we won’t be tempted to get over the devastation, we’re guarding ourselves against getting over something (etwas fertig zu werden) > we’d rather learn to wait until (bis) our essence becomes free/noble, when it fits (fügen) aptly (schicklich) w/ the mystery of this destiny (dem Geheimnis dieses Geschickes) [arrival? total ambiguity btwn waiting for.. and becoming free], wait as though this Fügsame consists (bestehen) in waiting, as though waiting would have to outlast (überdauern) death
HDG.EC.linkedContent: we won’t be tempted to get over the devastation, we’re guarding ourselves against getting over something (etwas fertig zu werden) > we’d rather learn to wait until (bis) our essence becomes free/noble, when it fits (fügen) aptly (schicklich) w/ the mystery of this destiny (dem Geheimnis dieses Geschickes) [arrival? total ambiguity btwn waiting for.. and becoming free], wait as though this Fügsame consists (bestehen) in waiting, as though waiting would have to outlast (überdauern) death

HDG.EC.content: death itself: something that waits in us > death waits upon our waiting > may we even ask what we wait for if we are properly waiting? [beyond Being] > when we wait upon something: Erwarten, in awaiting pure waiting is disturbed > pure waiting: wait upon nothing > but if we specifically wait upon Nothing, we are awaiting again > pure waiting: to wait on that which corresponds (entspricht) to pure waiting, better yet, that which answers (antwortet) pure waiting
HDG.EC.linkedContent: death itself: something that waits in us > death waits upon our waiting > may we even ask what we wait for if we are properly waiting? [beyond Being] > when we wait upon something: Erwarten, in awaiting pure waiting is disturbed > pure waiting: wait upon nothing > but if we specifically wait upon Nothing, we are awaiting again > pure waiting: to wait on that which corresponds (entspricht) to pure waiting, better yet, that which answers (antwortet) pure waiting

HDG.EC.content: in accustomed translation of mortality, it’s the relation to death, not to the immortals, that is named > only man, not animal, knows death, can go towards death > animal cannot die, cannot have death
HDG.EC.linkedContent: in accustomed translation of mortality, it’s the relation to death, not to the immortals, that is named > only man, not animal, knows death, can go towards death > animal cannot die, cannot have death

HDG.EC.content: only man can wait upon that which waits upon our entire being (Wesen) (like death) > as the being that can die, man is the being that waits > you have thought something beautiful
HDG.EC.linkedContent: only man can wait upon that which waits upon our entire being (Wesen) (like death) > as the being that can die, man is the being that waits > you have thought something beautiful

HDG.OHF.content: hermenutics: wakefulness (Wachsein) of Dasein for itself (not conventional understanding) > interpreting is a being, a distinctive how of character of being of facticity, that belongs to factical life itself (facticity not the object of hermeneutics) > chance that hermeneutics will go wrong belongs to its ownmost being
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: hermenutics: wakefulness (Wachsein) of Dasein for itself (not conventional understanding) > interpreting is a being, a distinctive how of character of being of facticity, that belongs to factical life itself (facticity not the object of hermeneutics) > chance that hermeneutics will go wrong belongs to its ownmost being

HDG.OHF.content: being of factical life is distinctive: it is in the how of the being of its being-possible > authentic be-ing itself places (gestellt) facticity into our forehaving (Vorhabe) > the explicata that grow out of this interpretation: existentials
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: being of factical life is distinctive: it is in the how of the being of its being-possible > authentic be-ing itself places (gestellt) facticity into our forehaving (Vorhabe) > the explicata that grow out of this interpretation: existentials

HDG.OHF.content: Kierkegaard: life only interpreted after lived, Christ couldn’t explain scriptures until after his resurrection
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: Kierkegaard: life only interpreted after lived, Christ couldn’t explain scriptures until after his resurrection

HDG.OHF.content: fundamental questionableness (Fraglichkeit) in Vorhabe, only as such could there be something like: “fixing” on an end (ein Ende “fest” machen), what is fixed on (or not) has being (Sein hat!) as a how of Dasein: how to relate this to death?
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: fundamental questionableness (Fraglichkeit) in Vorhabe, only as such could there be something like: “fixing” on an end (ein Ende “fest” machen), what is fixed on (or not) has being (Sein hat!) as a how of Dasein: how to relate this to death?

HDG.OHF.content: interpretation begins in the today (im Heute), average understanding from which philosophy lives and speaks back into > the “every-one (Das Man),” not just fallenness, but a How of factical Dasein
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: interpretation begins in the today (im Heute), average understanding from which philosophy lives and speaks back into > the “every-one (Das Man),” not just fallenness, but a How of factical Dasein

HDG.OHF.content: philosophy a mode of knowing in factical life itself, in which factical Dasein ruthlessly dragged back to itself, relentlessly thrown back (zurückreisst) on itself [cf. CPC p. 13]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: philosophy a mode of knowing in factical life itself, in which factical Dasein ruthlessly dragged back to itself, relentlessly thrown back (zurückreisst) on itself [cf. CPC p. 13]

HDG.OHF.content: [existential analytic defines the how of Dasein’s being] [re: temporality of today?] Dasein has its open space of publicness (Öffentlichkeit) and its ways of Seeing (seine Sicht) [there] [cf. 38 summary of today] > moves in definite mode of discourse (Redens) about itself: Gerede (talk) preserves Dasein in averageness > in talk lies guiding “as what” by which Dasein addresses “itself” > talk as the how in which Dasein’s having-been-interpreted (Ausgelegtheit) stands at its disposal > not externally applied to Dasein, something from out of which it lives, is lived, a how of is being
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [existential analytic defines the how of Dasein’s being] [re: temporality of today?] Dasein has its open space of publicness (Öffentlichkeit) and its ways of Seeing (seine Sicht) [there] [cf. 38 summary of today] > moves in definite mode of discourse (Redens) about itself: Gerede (talk) preserves Dasein in averageness > in talk lies guiding “as what” by which Dasein addresses “itself” > talk as the how in which Dasein’s having-been-interpreted (Ausgelegtheit) stands at its disposal > not externally applied to Dasein, something from out of which it lives, is lived, a how of is being

HDG.OHF.content: as open space of publicness, nothing eludes the talk: averageness (Durchschnittlichkeit), discusses everything w/ insensitivity to difference (Unterschiedsunempfindlichkeit) > Öffentlichkeit as being of “Man (every-one)”: everyone says that, everyone expects that, talk in circulation belongs to no one [Irigaray] > “Man” = “Niemand” > Dasein haunted like a specter by this circulation, a how of factical life that pays tribute to the fateful undoing (Verhängnisses) of facticity
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: as open space of publicness, nothing eludes the talk: averageness (Durchschnittlichkeit), discusses everything w/ insensitivity to difference (Unterschiedsunempfindlichkeit) > Öffentlichkeit as being of “Man (every-one)”: everyone says that, everyone expects that, talk in circulation belongs to no one [Irigaray] > “Man” = “Niemand” > Dasein haunted like a specter by this circulation, a how of factical life that pays tribute to the fateful undoing (Verhängnisses) of facticity

HDG.OHF.content: [periodization] historical human sciences view life of culture as objectifications of the subjective (don’t further examine character of being): culture is an organism, autonomous organic life > Spengler took this way of seeing the past the furthest [?], had courage to actualize [further than Nietzsche?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [periodization] historical human sciences view life of culture as objectifications of the subjective (don’t further examine character of being): culture is an organism, autonomous organic life > Spengler took this way of seeing the past the furthest [?], had courage to actualize [further than Nietzsche?]

HDG.OHF.content: [phenomenology beyond dialectic] dialectic directionless (richtungslos) when no Grundblick in direction of (auf) the subject matter (Sache), a rationality testing/proving itself by looking this way (i.e. not dialectically) [Heidegger uses rationality affirmatively here?] > all dialectic lives from table of others, Hegel: “this traditional material” (Plato, Aristotle) “extremely importance source, indeed a necessary condition [and] presupposition to be gratefully acknowledged” (Science of Logic) > dialectic is double-sidedly un-radical: 1) lives from hand to mouth 2) eloquent about readymade material
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [phenomenology beyond dialectic] dialectic directionless (richtungslos) when no Grundblick in direction of (auf) the subject matter (Sache), a rationality testing/proving itself by looking this way (i.e. not dialectically) [Heidegger uses rationality affirmatively here?] > all dialectic lives from table of others, Hegel: “this traditional material” (Plato, Aristotle) “extremely importance source, indeed a necessary condition [and] presupposition to be gratefully acknowledged” (Science of Logic) > dialectic is double-sidedly un-radical: 1) lives from hand to mouth 2) eloquent about readymade material

HDG.OHF.content: “tarrying among (Verweilen bei)” sustains possibility of actualizing a universal classifying that compares [historical] forms, in it lies relational guarantee that every past culture can be encountered objectively > a constant seeing this & that, can never halt [cf. 45 abode-less tarrying (das aufenthaltslose Verweilen) that holds itself/sojourns in (Aufhalten) what it returns to) > what’s encountered in this Verweilen as universal possibility of expression, divided into unities of style: beings in the How of their having-being, already there [for us to see] (i.e. past is available, is a past present, not our virtuality) > a pull (Zug) arises from the already there (schon da) in the past: world, life, publicness, what was going on [if destruction occurs by thinking Zug outside of Zug of historical consciousness, deconstruction occurs by noting that Zug of historical consciousness never occurs, i.e that everyday facticity has been overdetermined, we were never that close to it]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: “tarrying among (Verweilen bei)” sustains possibility of actualizing a universal classifying that compares [historical] forms, in it lies relational guarantee that every past culture can be encountered objectively > a constant seeing this & that, can never halt [cf. 45 abode-less tarrying (das aufenthaltslose Verweilen) that holds itself/sojourns in (Aufhalten) what it returns to) > what’s encountered in this Verweilen as universal possibility of expression, divided into unities of style: beings in the How of their having-being, already there [for us to see] (i.e. past is available, is a past present, not our virtuality) > a pull (Zug) arises from the already there (schon da) in the past: world, life, publicness, what was going on [if destruction occurs by thinking Zug outside of Zug of historical consciousness, deconstruction occurs by noting that Zug of historical consciousness never occurs, i.e that everyday facticity has been overdetermined, we were never that close to it]

HDG.OHF.content: being everywhere & nowhere of philosophical knowing: an absolute curiosity (Neugier) [Heidegger then describes something close to idle talk, how philosophy is public, has an autonomous curiosity, gives itself a foothold in life, thus preserving itself]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: being everywhere & nowhere of philosophical knowing: an absolute curiosity (Neugier) [Heidegger then describes something close to idle talk, how philosophy is public, has an autonomous curiosity, gives itself a foothold in life, thus preserving itself]

HDG.OHF.content: objective scientific type of philosophy: proper refuge (Schutzwehr) in which Dasein protected from abysmal (bodenlosen) relativism, finds a secure foothold, brings objective possibility of more objective agreement (Übereinstimmung), “All of us…”, i.e. presents Dasein w/ tranquil certainty/security (ruhige Sicherheit) of general/unanimous “yes, I agree” [a force against snarl of worldviews, & rampant skepticism of our day] > when the system is dynamic has character of life itself, simultaneously universal & concrete [not subjective]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: objective scientific type of philosophy: proper refuge (Schutzwehr) in which Dasein protected from abysmal (bodenlosen) relativism, finds a secure foothold, brings objective possibility of more objective agreement (Übereinstimmung), “All of us…”, i.e. presents Dasein w/ tranquil certainty/security (ruhige Sicherheit) of general/unanimous “yes, I agree” [a force against snarl of worldviews, & rampant skepticism of our day] > when the system is dynamic has character of life itself, simultaneously universal & concrete [not subjective]

HDG.OHF.content: [Hegel as objective scientific philosophy] “Spirit” now lives in abode (Ort) of its self-certainty, no more goals, feelings, interests: “life has retired (zurückgezogen) into its authentic freedom”
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [Hegel as objective scientific philosophy] “Spirit” now lives in abode (Ort) of its self-certainty, no more goals, feelings, interests: “life has retired (zurückgezogen) into its authentic freedom”

HDG.OHF.content: forehaving: what is had in advance re: accessing/dealing w/ matter in question > fate of our approach (das Schicksal des Ansatzes) hangs on the primordiality (Ürsprunglichkeit) & genuineness (Echtheit) of the forehaving (in which Dasein as such [factical life] has been placed) [how can you ever assess forehaving unless you simply presume proximity?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: forehaving: what is had in advance re: accessing/dealing w/ matter in question > fate of our approach (das Schicksal des Ansatzes) hangs on the primordiality (Ürsprunglichkeit) & genuineness (Echtheit) of the forehaving (in which Dasein as such [factical life] has been placed) [how can you ever assess forehaving unless you simply presume proximity?]

HDG.OHF.content: decisive for development (Ausbildung) of a forehaving: seeing Dasein in its everydayness (Alltäglichkeit) > [cf. p. 62] formal indication of forehaving, in average everydayness: factical life means being-in-a-world > what is meant by “world” by “in” by “being”? investigation of each word not piecemeal but one point of view on same unitary phenomenon [demonstrated in intuition?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: decisive for development (Ausbildung) of a forehaving: seeing Dasein in its everydayness (Alltäglichkeit) > [cf. p. 62] formal indication of forehaving, in average everydayness: factical life means being-in-a-world > what is meant by “world” by “in” by “being”? investigation of each word not piecemeal but one point of view on same unitary phenomenon [demonstrated in intuition?]

HDG.OHF.content: world as something we are concerned about/attend to (Besorgte), shows itself as the wherefrom, out of which, and on the basis of which factical life is lived (woraus das faktische Leben lebt)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: world as something we are concerned about/attend to (Besorgte), shows itself as the wherefrom, out of which, and on the basis of which factical life is lived (woraus das faktische Leben lebt)

HDG.OHF.content: as-what & How of the world’s being-encountered (Begegnens) lie in significance (Bedeutsamkeit), significance not a category of things but the categorial dimension of being-there > being of world & human life both designated by term Dasein > on basis of factical spatiality we can define ontological meaning of being “in” the environs (Umhaften) of world > “being” that encounters world as Weltdasein, characterized by caring, fundamental mode of being, it “is” its world, the very world it has encountered [hermeneutic circle]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: as-what & How of the world’s being-encountered (Begegnens) lie in significance (Bedeutsamkeit), significance not a category of things but the categorial dimension of being-there > being of world & human life both designated by term Dasein > on basis of factical spatiality we can define ontological meaning of being “in” the environs (Umhaften) of world > “being” that encounters world as Weltdasein, characterized by caring, fundamental mode of being, it “is” its world, the very world it has encountered [hermeneutic circle]

HDG.OHF.content: [encounter others] appearance of a with-world, not object of knowing, but Vorhandenheit > advance appearance (Vorschein) of factical lives of others: “in a with-world” > others encountered in the “with-”world as others bringing w/ them the “one-self”
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [encounter others] appearance of a with-world, not object of knowing, but Vorhandenheit > advance appearance (Vorschein) of factical lives of others: “in a with-world” > others encountered in the “with-”world as others bringing w/ them the “one-self”

HDG.OHF.content: authentic mode of being in world is caring, meaning: producing, putting in place, directing ourselves to tasks, taking into possession, preventing, protecting against loss, etc. > in caring, life approaches/addresses itself (anspricht sich) in a worldly man > caring always concerned about itself [auto-affection?]: not a reflexivity of caring back upon itself, no, caring meets up w/ itself in a worldy manner in the there it is encountering [from implicit to explicit] > to be in the how of such caring: Besorgnis (anxious concern and its apprehensions)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: authentic mode of being in world is caring, meaning: producing, putting in place, directing ourselves to tasks, taking into possession, preventing, protecting against loss, etc. > in caring, life approaches/addresses itself (anspricht sich) in a worldly man > caring always concerned about itself [auto-affection?]: not a reflexivity of caring back upon itself, no, caring meets up w/ itself in a worldy manner in the there it is encountering [from implicit to explicit] > to be in the how of such caring: Besorgnis (anxious concern and its apprehensions)

HDG.OHF.content: life cares for itself, and since care in each case has a language, life addresses itself (anspricht sich) in a worldly manner
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: life cares for itself, and since care in each case has a language, life addresses itself (anspricht sich) in a worldly manner
